title: List of people granted executive clemency in the first presidency of Donald Trump
added: | Lying to a federal grand jury about bribes

| Holtz, an influential [[Miami, Florida]] banker and philanthropist who founded Capital Bank, pleaded guilty in October 1994 to lying to a [[federal grand jury]] about paying tens of thousands of dollars in bribes to [[Alex Daoud]], a corrupt city commissioner (and later mayor) of [[Miami Beach, Florida|Miami Beach]]. Holtz' previous 2006 pardon application was denied by President [[George W. Bush]].<ref>Jay Weaver & Martin Vassolo, [https://www.miamiherald.com/news/local/article248628490.html Influential Miami banker Abel Holtz, who lied about bribes, gets Trump pardon], ''Miami Herald'' (January 20, 2021).</ref>

| Renzi, a former Republican congressman from 2003 to 2009 from a northeastern [[Arizona]] district, was convicted in 2013 on 17 federal counts, including racketeering, money laundering, extortion, and filing false statements with regulators. He served three years in prison and was released in 2017. Renzi denied wrongdoing and insisted that the prosecution was politically motivated.<ref>Andrew Oxford & Ronald J. Hansen, [https://www.azcentral.com/story/news/politics/arizona/2021/01/19/former-arizona-rep-rick-renzi-pardoned-trump-land-swap-case/4184460001/ Trump pardons former U.S. Rep. Rick Renzi of Arizona over land swap], ''Arizona Republic'' (January 19, 2021).</ref>

added: | Bowker, of New York, was convicted of 1993 was convicted of wildlife trafficking for illegally arranging the delivery of 22 [[Timber rattlesnake]]s to the Miami Serpentarium (a tourist attraction in [[South Florida]]) in an swap with Rudy "Cobra King" Komarek for 22 [[American alligator]]s. He was sentenced to two years' probation.<ref>Marc Freeman, [https://www.sun-sentinel.com/news/fl-ne-trump-pardons-south-florida-20210120-6igdgbmbc5hbhjztraecqgkc74-story.html A snake trafficker gets a Trump pardon. Here’s the only-in-Florida story behind the case.], ''South Florida Sun Sentinel'' (January 20, 2021).</ref>
